headline: Does Buffett’s Exit and Abel’s Arrival Shift the Long-Term Case for Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A)?
summary: Berkshire Hathaway has completed fixed-income offerings totaling ¥210.1 billion across four tranches, including callable senior unsecured notes with maturities up to 2040, and announced Warren Buffett will step down as CEO at the end of the year, with Greg Abel as his successor. This leadership transition comes as Berkshire's cash and treasury holdings have reached a very large ¥382 billion, reflecting a cautious approach to elevated stock valuations during Buffett's final years at the...
